news_header: China resumes import of Australian lobsters after a four-year diplomatic dispute.
news_text: After a significant diplomatic rift during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, when Australia called for investigations into the virus's origins, China has allowed the import of Australian lobsters back into its market. This dispute led to China restricting imports of various Australian products. China is a crucial trading partner for Australia, with nearly half of Australia's goods exports directed to China in 2020, while China seeks to acquire Australia's natural resources.
